caption: Phenomenal! This is one of my favorite spots in Gainesville and just what our town needed. Fresh and quality ingredients with a lot of love put into some great Flavors. We come weekly for the salads, love their brunch and would highly recommend trying them out. I hope they eventually change their hours and are open for dinner :)
I had the toast and ham egg and cheese breakfast English muffin. Was huge and delicious

I am outraged!!! My first experience with this place was amazing! I am outraged because I know it’s one of those very few places I will go forever and may never order from the menu because the specials are so original and delicious. First I walk in and staff was awesome, and as I prepare to order my previously strategized selections from the website, the bar maiden/vixen offers for me to be the first to try their new Reuben special! Completely insulted I said “yes please”...have you ever had in-house corned beef? Now I can say I have. It’s my new religion. In all seriousness, this place is putting out seriously quality food off the beaten path of Sysco’s monthly special. If you appreciate craft food and beverage, this place will make you update your list of special spots. Cheers
Great sandwiches, the best in Gainesville. I would give it 5 stars if the prices were more reasonable.

It's always wonderful when new eateries come to town. Especially when the food is delicious. We've only been there once so far, but will be back. The turkey sandwich with the jerked honey mustard is excellent. The philly was good too. The service was cheerful and engaging. Welcome The Leaning Pig, we are thrilled to have you in downtown G'ville.
If the chicken sandwich is on special, get it and don't think twice.  Gabagool was delicious today as well as the other sandwiches. Will be going back when I'm in the area.
Fish plate and meat and cheese plate were amazing!

Was sad to see the old Gelato Company close down here but this place is awesome. The inside is totally revamped and it looks great. I like the uniqueness of their menu items. New breakfast burrito was on point. Hope they extend their hours once they get a good following because I would definitely come by for dinner and get a draft at the bar

I am a long time fan and customer of Dorns and when I heard they opened up a restaurant, the Leaning Pig.. I was super excited.   My family and I went today to try it for the first time and it was absolutely fantastic!  The sandwiches and salads are the best in town!   They also  serve beautiful charcuterie boards, wine and beer.   We will be going back regularly.    I highly recommend you try it.   You will not be disappointed

Cute, small shop in Gainesville! Not only is the food very tasty, but the items on the menu are well priced for college students near UF! I tried the turkey sandwich with avocado with my family during move-in, and I definitely plan on coming back with 4 or 5 times each semester! Thank you so much for the great food and hospitality!

I'm not usually a fan of ham because it's typically too salty, but the house cured ham in their sandwiches is on point! I also like their charcuterie boards, nice variety with new cheeses and meats every so often. Salads are unique and delicious. Very generous portions for the price point. We got takeout and they had our food ready right on time. I'd definitely come back for brunch again.
Charcuterie Appetizer was nice. For my first experience and all I had heard, I wish it was a little more.

Definitely a spot to check out. The "Sando's" are amazing and the prices are fair for the quality, I had the avocado with a side of fries and it was fantastic. The only disappointment is that they're not open for dinner yet.
The Gainesville hot tempeh was mind-blowing and the avocado sando definitely hit the spot!
